result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary Diane Myers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments. To be paid during term of probation on count two.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  To be collected during term of probation. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Mental health assessment.   Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician.

No new law violations.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with William and Kathleen M. subject to modification by agent if victim request modification.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
Court allows for expungement on count two, if defendant successfully completes all terms and conditions of probation.

Cooperate with agent.
Attend parenting classes.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mary Diane Myers in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charges.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on the amended charges as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with release privileges to the Day Reporting Center for mental health treatment, AODA assessment and treatment, consecutive to COUNT 2, with credit for 58 days time served.
-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of probation on COUNT 2; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Corrections, straight time, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Attend parenting classes
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician
-No contact with William and Kathleen M. subject to modification by agent if victim requests modification
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Court allows for expungement on COUNT 2 if defendant successfully completes all terms and conditions of probation

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Mary Diane Myers in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Mary Diane Myers in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, State amends the original charge of Burglary to Criminal Trespass pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec 943.14, a Class A Misdemeanor and Operating Vehicle Without Owner's Consent (Take & Drive) pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.23(2), a Class H Felony.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Mary Diane Myers not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a jury trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Diane Myers in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant is being referred to Drug Treatment Program.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Mary Diane Myers not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense requested more time to review the offer. State does not object to an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Mary Diane Myers not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Mary Diane Myers not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Diane Myers in court with Attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Mary Diane Myers in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  
Defense counsel requests to be heard as to bail on the next court date.

Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Edmund M.; Kathleen M.; Jeffry M. or William M

Defendant Mary Diane Myers in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Mary Diane Myers in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
